ygData.subject: Guardians Rythmns and Magic Resistance
ygData.msgSnippet: I posted this to another bard list: Yes casters are a pain. I found that the best way to weather the intial onslaught is to twist Guardian and Elemental
ygData.messageBody:
I posted this to another bard list:
Yes casters are a pain. I found that the best way to weather the intial
onslaught is to twist Guardian and Elemental Rythmns with a drum plus have
the Cleric/Shaman in the party cast Endure Magic on you. With this combo I
can boast my MR to 122 (I have lots of MR boasting items too). I have
weathered multiable force shocks/lightening blasts/etc.. with this combo.
Plus the rest of the party does better too . I love seeing the 'You have
resisted Force Shock' message, esp when is was casted by a red mob.

>From: CMai <CMai@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: "'eqbards@onelist.com'" <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Quick question re: choices of primary & secondary w
>eapons
>Date: Mon, 14 Jun 1999 11:04:53 -0400
>
>From: CMai <CMai@...>
>
>question about guardian song. Does it really work? I mean I saw the
>resist
>increase but I still get dmg by spell users npc just the same. I do not
>see
>it getting any better.
>
>Your Friendly Rogue and Bard
>Hammerpaw and Samiam
>Champions of Norrath, The Rathe

All the increased resistance means is that you have a better chance or
reducing the amount of damage from the caster, it is not immunity to magic.
Also all the Rythmn songs work much better with a drum.

Rokenn Swiftsong
Master Brewer of Societus Argenti
Karana Server
